newsitem.title: CHINA: China starts laying Three Gorges power cables.
newsitem.headline: China starts laying Three Gorges power cables.

text.p: China has started laying the first power transmission line of of the gargantuan Three Gorges Dam project on the Yangtze River, the Xinhua news agency said.
The State Power Grid Development Co Ltd was in charge of the 176-km power transmission line from Changshou county to Wanxian city in southwestern Sichuan province, Xinhua said in an overnight report.

The project, to be completed in May 1998, was the first part of a grid of more than 80 such lines to carry power from the dam that will block the mighty Yangtze River in neighbouring Hubei province, Xinhua said.
The line would be a segment of a larger project to link the dam with Sichuan's mega-city of Chongqing. That project would be completed in 2002, it said.
Xinhua did not say how much the transmission line would cost but said the network would cost 27.5 billion yuan ($3.3 billion).
